授業目的:
＜Reading＞EC2 Reading is designed to develop students’ confidence, fluency, speed, and interest in reading in English.
＜Speaking＞ EC2 Speaking aims to enable students to have basic discussions on given topics. Students read articles about the topics and talk about the topics. They learn discussion questions, skills and language which help them to talk about the topics.
到達目標:
Students in EC3 Reading will be able to 1) increase their comprehension of a variety of texts 2) increase their vocabulary knowledge and 3) develop reading fluency, confidence and speed.
Students will be able to improve their academic discussion skills through reading articles and discussing them in class. Students learn vocabulary, discussion questions, and discussion skills.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: <all> Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
In class, students will practice intensive reading skills and learn vocabulary by reading articles and completing response tasks for graded readers.
EC2 Speaking prepares students to have basic discussions. The first part of the course introduces students to the idea of discussions while the second part introduces students to topic-related academic articles. Throughout the course, there are many opportunities for students to practice pair discussions.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Students will read graded readers, write graded reader response tasks, take online quizzes, and study vocabulary.
Students will read the articles, understand them, and memorise key sentences from them. They will complete homework related to the articles. They will also study topic-related vocabulary and grammar and use them in their graded homework preparation for the speaking tests. They should also try to have practice discussions outside class.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
＜Reading＞.. Students will be assessed through unit tests, book tests, Xreading quizzes, and written responses to graded readers and discussions.
＜Speaking> Students will be assessed by speaking tests, homework tests and a practical English test. They also have to submit written homework and participate actively in class.
